titles.title: Princess Principal
プリンセス・プリンシパル
Принцесса-шпионка
Princess Principal
Princess Principal
Princess Principal
프린세스 프린서플
Princess Principal

anime.description: At the end of the 19th century, London, the Kingdom of Albion has been split into East and West sides by a giant wall. Five girls attend Queen`s Mayfaire, a conventional and prestigious school. Under the guise of regular high school girls, they act as spies under cover. Disguise, reconnaissance, infiltration, car chases... Each girl uses their own set of special skills to dart around the world of shadow. Source: sentai filmworks Note: the DVD/BD release swaps the order of episodes 6 and 7, and also of episodes 8 and 9.

externalentity.identifier: プリンセス・プリンシパル

tag.name: military
tag.description: The military, also known as the armed forces, are forces authorized and legally entitled to use deadly force so as to support the interests of the state and its citizens. The task of the military is usually defined as defence of the state and its citizens and the prosecution of war against foreign powers. The military may also have additional functions within a society, including construction, emergency services, social ceremonies, and guarding critical areas. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: all-girls school
tag.description: This school is only for female students. There may be a few male teachers though.

tag.name: martial arts
tag.description: Various sports or skills, mainly of Japanese origin, that originated as forms of self-defense or attack, such as judo, karate, and kendo.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: swordplay
tag.description: The act or art of using a sword or similar weapon skillfully.

tag.name: past
tag.description: Anime that takes place in the past or clearly seems to take place in the past in case of an alternative universe. This category should almost always go together with one of its sub-categories, because the past can either be a depiction of a historical event(s) or not, in which case it would be alternative past.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: human enhancement
tag.description: Human enhancement can take various forms: It can be something comparatively non-intrusive as a power-up drug, a form of machine implantation or cyberization (http://anidb.net/a4414 [SAC Solid State Society]), or outright - possibly atrocious - genetic manipulation (http://anidb.net/a361 [Ao no 6 Gou]). Plot-wise enhanced protagonists in anime usually have to pay a price for their enhancements, be it physical or mental.

tag.name: alternative past
tag.description: An anime that takes place in an alternative past is an anime that clearly does not belong to the future or the present, and isn`t tied particularly closely to our history, or has ties to our history but only as a premise: there are too many things that don`t make sense for the time-period. In some cases there is futuristic technology present, but the overall setting still feels that of the past. However the setting must still take place on Earth, since we can not know if the history of a fantasy world is an alternate one or not.

tag.name: historical
tag.description: Historical anime have clear ties to our history and usually occur in a particular epoch.

tag.name: Victorian period
tag.description: The Victorian era of British history was the period of Queen Victoria`s reign from 20 June 1837 until her death on 22 January 1901. The Victorian Era style of clothing, however, ended in 1912. It was a long period of peace, prosperity, refined sensibilities and national self-confidence for Britain. Some scholars date the beginning of the period in terms of sensibilities and political concerns to the passage of the Reform Act 1832. A famous era for old classic literature works.

tag.name: London
tag.description: London is the capital and most populous city of both England and the United Kingdom. Standing on the River Thames in the south east of the island of Great Britain, London has been a major settlement for two millennia. It was founded by the Romans, who named it Londinium. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: plot continuity
tag.description: Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer. A single linear focused plot is highly continuous. A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: United Kingdom
tag.description: The United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland, commonly known as the United Kingdom (UK) or Britain, is a sovereign country in western Europe. Lying off the north-western coast of the European mainland, the UK includes the island of Great Britain, the north-eastern part of the island of Ireland and many smaller islands. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Europe
tag.description: Europe is a continent located entirely in the Northern Hemisphere and mostly in the Eastern Hemisphere. It is bordered by the Arctic Ocean to the north, the Atlantic Ocean to the west, and the Mediterranean Sea to the south. It comprises the westernmost part of Eurasia. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: friendship
tag.description: The feeling of trust, kindness, and friendship between a group of high school students for example, is a central theme of this anime.

tag.name: politics
tag.description: From commies to fat capitalist pigs, all the stuff done by the "guys with the power", mainly evil tactics for gaining more power over the masses. Watching this title may remind you why CNN is boring.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: steampunk
tag.description: Steampunk is a sub-genre of science fiction that typically features steam-powered machinery, especially in a setting inspired by industrialized Western civilization during the 19th century. Steampunk works are often set in an alternative history of the 19th century`s British Victorian era or American "Wild West", in a post-apocalyptic future during which steam power has regained mainstream use, or in a fantasy world that similarly employs steam power. Noteworthy attributes of the theme include large amounts smoke pollution from wood or coal burning, the affinity to metal constructs like cogs and metal tubing, and the mechanization of everyday objects. Steampunk perhaps most recognisably features anachronistic technologies or retro-futuristic inventions as people in the 19th century might have envisioned them, and is likewise rooted in the era`s perspective on fashion, culture, architectural style, and art. Such technology may include fictional machines like those found in the works of H. G. Wells and Jules Verne, or the modern authors Philip Pullman, Scott Westerfeld, Stephen Hunt and China Miéville. Other examples of steampunk contain alternative history-style presentations of such technology as lighter-than-air airships, analog computers, or such digital mechanical computers as Charles Babbage`s Analytical Engine. Steampunk can also exemplify everything that is bad about unrestrained technological progress (dead matter), when compared to life and nature. The anime usually makes a point to propound the latter. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: crime
tag.description: The underworld we talk about here is not to be confused with the place where people are believed to go after they die, but the general term for organized crime. It is a shady world, unknown to most people, where illegal things like murder, smuggling, drug dealing and similar are happening daily. Groups known to be acting in this world are for example the mafia or the yakuza.

tag.name: disaster
tag.description: A disaster is a large-scale situation that causes great loss of or damage or threat to life, health, property, society, or the environment, irrespective of its source or cause. Disasters have substantial, long-lasting negative repercussions, and great effort must be spent in order to undo or mitigate their effects.

tag.name: conspiracy
tag.description: The conspiracy thriller (or paranoid thriller) is a sub-genre of the thriller which flourished in the 1970s in the US (and was echoed in other parts of the world) in the wake of a number of high-profile scandals and controversies (most notably Vietnam, the assassination of President Kennedy, Chappaquiddick and Watergate), and which exposed what many people regarded as the clandestine machinations and conspiracies beneath the orderly fabric of political life. The protagonists of conspiracy thrillers are often journalists or amateur investigators who find themselves (often inadvertently) pulling on a small thread which unravels a vast conspiracy that ultimately goes "all the way to the top".

tag.name: war
tag.description: War is a phenomenon of organized violent conflict, typified by extreme aggression, societal disruption and adaptation, and high mortality. The objective of warfare differs in accord with a group`s role in a conflict: The goals of offensive warfare are typically the submission, assimilation or destruction of another group, while the goals of defensive warfare are simply the repulsion of the offensive force and, often, survival itself. Relative to each other, combatants in warfare are called enemies. The terms military, militant, and militarism each refer to fundamental aspects of war, i.e. the organized group, the combative individual, and the supportive ethos (respectively). Source: wiki

tag.name: human experimentation
tag.description: Genetic, biological, chemical or psychological experimentation on human beings are portrayed or their aftermath is shown.

tag.name: car chases
tag.description: Car chases occur as part of the action setting in this anime.

tag.name: child abuse
tag.description: Story depicts child abuse, which is a very complex and dangerous set of problems that include child neglect and the physical, emotional, and sexual abuse of children.

tag.name: in medias res
tag.description: In medias res, also medias in res (Latin for "into the midst of affairs (lit. into mid-affairs)"), refers to a literary and artistic technique where the narrative starts in the middle of the story instead of from its beginning. It is generally a plot-driven concept rather than a character-driven one; though characters are commonly used to provide the backstory. The characters, setting, and conflict are often introduced through a series of http://anidb.net/t4299 [flashbacks] or through characters relating past events to each other. Probably originating from an oral tradition, the technique is a convention of epic poetry, one of the earliest and most prominent examples in Western literature being Homer`s Odyssey and Iliad. Virgil`s Aeneid began the tradition in literature of imitating Homer, continued in Torquato Tasso`s Jerusalem Delivered, John Milton`s Paradise Lost and "Inferno" from Dante`s Divine Comedy. George Lucas`s Star Wars saga was told using in medias res.

tag.name: ensemble cast
tag.description:
A show with an ensemble cast focuses on a larger group of main characters in a single plot narrative; anime containing several segmented plot narratives (such as episodic or arc-based plots) are excluded. As such, it doesn`t really have a "main" or "lead" character; instead, every member of the central main character group plays an important part in the show`s grander scheme; no single character is more important or prominent than the others (equality of importance). Further, subplots (if any) lead by each character in the ensemble have equal weighting in importance (or lack of weight).
* In a show where no single main character is more important or prominent than the others, 4+ main characters is almost always an ensemble cast. * A show with 3 main characters of equal importance is likely also an ensemble cast; equality of importance must be considered carefully. * A show with 2 main characters of equal importance is generally not an ensemble cast situation; however, on an exception basis where neither main character is considered an antagonist, a 2-main-character anime may be considered an ensemble (e.g. http://anidb.net/a11829 [Kimi no Na wa.]).
Pictured: http://anidb.net/a9043 [K (anime)]

tag.name: murder
tag.description: To murder means to bring about someone else`s death, by a voluntary act. Whether it comes from the killer`s own hand or by exposing the victim to life-threatening circumstances, the result is foreseeable and sought by the perpetrator. Someone who murders as their profession/job is an http://anidb.net/t2399 [assassin or hitman].

tag.name: predominantly female cast
tag.description: A show with a predominantly female cast has mostly females as main and secondary cast members while few if any male characters have major roles. This also applies when a male lead is surrounded by females of lesser individual plot relevance, such as in a harem setting.

tag.name: time skip
tag.description: The plot features at least one skip or jump in time. Example: A skip from the present into the past, or time skips in increments, e.g. every hour there is a time skip by a day.

tag.name: imperialism
tag.description: Imperialism is a type of advocacy of empire. Its name originated from the Latin word "imperium", which means to rule over large territories. Imperialism is "a policy of extending a country`s power and influence through colonization, use of military force, or other means". Source: Wiki

tag.name: secret organisation
tag.description: A secret organisation or secret society is an organisation whose activities and inner functioning are concealed from non-members. The society may or may not attempt to conceal its existence itself. Examples of historical and existing secret societies include Freemasonry, the Knights Templar, the Rosicrucians, Skull and Bones, the Thule Society, and the Illuminati.

tag.name: anachronisms
tag.description: Customs, events, or objects are shown in a period to which they do not belong, e.g. jet planes in medieval Japan.

tag.name: female protagonist
tag.description: The anime has a female protagonist.

tag.name: ass-kicking girls
tag.description: The female characters in the anime are very proficient in some form of martial arts, swordplay, or gunfights. They may also have super powers.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: death
tag.description: Death is the state of no longer being alive or the process of ceasing to be alive.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Chise
character.description: Chise is a 16-year-old exchange student from Saga, Japan, who originally joined the team to protect a http://anidb.net/ch92201 [Japanese diplomat] from an http://anidb.net/ch92200 [assassin] who was related to her. She is highly proficient in samurai-style swordsmanship and is considered the strongest of the spies in melee combat. She often acts naive and has a hard time adapting to the culture differences. She is a spy for Japan tasked with observing the Commonwealth and Kingdom so that her superiors can determine which country to ally with. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Ange
character.description: Ange is a 17-year-old master spy who can change her personality almost at whim to whatever is required for her mission. She is adept at both telling and detecting lies, often hiding her true knowledge as tales from the "Black Lizard Planet." She also possesses stolen prototype Cavorite technology that allows her to increase or decrease the gravity of herself and anything she touches when active. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Dorothy
character.description: Dorothy is a 20-year-old undercover student who loves drinking wine and booze, even though her teammates are too young to do so. Dorothy uses her feminine charm in missions and is good at shooting and driving vehicles. Her real name is Daisy MacBean, who changed her name and fled after her mother died and her father constantly abused her in a drunken rage. "Dorothy" is her mother`s name. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Oujo Charlotte
character.description: Princess Charlotte is 17-years-old. She is the niece of the http://anidb.net/ch90366 [Duke of Normandy] and fourth in the line of succession for the throne of the Albion Kingdom. The Princess has a relatively calm and disarming demeanor, and easily gets along well with others. Her dream is to become Queen and re-unify the country. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Beatrice
character.description: Beatrice is the 15-year-old scion of a prestigious family who serves as the http://anidb.net/ch88463 [Princess]` aide and close friend. She can mimic the voices of other people using a mechanism that her father implanted in her throat, after he treated her as a test subject for his experiments. Source: Wikipedia
7 is a member of http://anidb.net/ch92208 [Control], the intelligence unit handling http://anidb.net/ch92207 [Principal Team].

character.name: L
character.description: L is a member of http://anidb.net/ch92208 [Control], the intelligence unit handling http://anidb.net/ch92207 [Principal Team].

character.name: Gazelle
character.description: Gazelle is one of the http://anidb.net/ch90366 [Duke of Normandy]`s most-trusted agents, a dark-skinned woman who collects information and can kill anyone who poses a threat to her employer. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Normandy-kou
character.description: The Duke of Normandy is the Home Secretary of the Albion Kingdom and http://anidb.net/ch88463 [Princess Charlotte]`s uncle. He handles the Kingdom`s espionage affairs and personally has hunted down potential defectors from the Kingdom, either to use them for counter-espionage against the Commonwealth`s agents or kill them outright. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Taisa
character.description: The Colonel is a member of http://anidb.net/ch92208 [Control] and the Commonwealth military`s representative. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Lily Gaveston
character.description: Lily Gaveston is the daughter of the Kingdom`s Chief Judge and one of the Home Secretary`s collaborators.

character.name: Eric
character.description: Eric is a scientist that sought to defect to the Commonwealth. He was taken to safety by http://anidb.net/ch88461 [Ange] and her fellow spies http://anidb.net/ch88462 [Dorothy], http://anidb.net/ch88464 [Beatrice], http://anidb.net/ch88460 [Chise] and http://anidb.net/ch88463 [Princess], inside the Queen`s Mayfair School, a prestigious academy where they were posing as students.

character.name: Amy
character.description: Amy is http://anidb.net/ch92196 [Eric]`s little sister, who is suffering from Cavonite poisoning, which requires an expensive procedure to cure.

character.name: Kimble
character.description: Kimble was the Public Security Minister of the Albion Kingdom.

character.name: Toudou Juubee
character.description: Toudou Juubee is an assassin hired by http://anidb.net/ch90366 [the Duke of Normandy] to kill http://anidb.net/ch92201 [Lord Horikawa] of the Japanese delegation. He`s also http://anidb.net/ch88460 [Chise]`s father.

character.name: Principal Team
character.description: Principal Team is a team of spies, working for the Commonwealth, with a mission to help http://anidb.net/ch88463 [Princess Charlotte] become the Queen of the Kingdom in order to re-unify the country.

character.name: Control
character.description: The Control is a secret service working for the Commonwealth, supervising the operations led by the http://anidb.net/ch92207 [Principal Team].

character.name: Danny McBean
character.description: Danny McBean is the coroner and http://anidb.net/ch88462 [Dorothy]`s father. He`s an accomplice of the http://anidb.net/ch90366 [Duke of Normandy], who was given a task to recover a code cipher hidden in the body of a deceased Kingdom agent. Dorothy revealed that he used to be a brilliant steam engineer before losing his hand in an accident, and began taking out his anger on everybody around him, including his daughter, which caused her to run away from home. Source: Wikipedia, edited.

character.name: Marilla
character.description: Marilla is the main laundress at the Little Lambs Laundry, where members of the http://anidb.net/ch92207 [Principal Team] were sent to investigate the Poison Gas Jack case. She was responsible for everyone`s welfare and later appointed as a foreman, after http://anidb.net/ch88463 [Princess Charlotte] bought the laundry and her team finished their mission.

character.name: Rita
character.description: Rita is one of the laundresses that work at Little Lamb Laundry.

character.name: Julie
character.description: Julie is a pickpocket girl that helped http://anidb.net/ch88461 [Ange] identify the http://anidb.net/ch90364 [person] who lord O`Reilly was meeting with.

character.name: Iinchou
character.description: Prefect is http://anidb.net/ch88461 [Ange]`s and http://anidb.net/ch88462 [Dorothy]`s former classmate from the spy-training school, the Farm, led by the http://anidb.net/ch92208 [Control]. Ange, Dorothy and http://anidb.net/ch88464 [Beatrice] were sent on a mission to steal secret documents from the First Lord of the Admiralty and Prefect was their insider as a fellow spy. However, their secondary mission was to check whether she was double agent, which turned out to be true. Before they could capture her, she committed suicide. Source: Wikipedia, edited.

character.name: General
character.description: The General is a military officer that took the charge of the http://anidb.net/ch92208 [Control], relieving http://anidb.net/ch90363 [L] of his position as a head. He changed the course of the operation Changeling in a way to assassinate http://anidb.net/ch88463 [Princess Charlotte]. However, his plan failed and he was relieved of his position, allowing L to come back.

character.name: Zelda
character.description: Zelda is the spy and the http://anidb.net/ch88463 [Princess]` bodyguard sent by the http://anidb.net/ch92208 [Control] after http://anidb.net/ch92239 [General] took over it. She played a major role in assassination attempt.

character.name: Yngwie
character.description: Major Yngwie is a military officer that allied the soldiers from various colonies under the Kingdom`s reign in an attempt to gather an army large enough to overthrow and assassinate her Majesty the Queen. He was introduced by http://anidb.net/ch92240 [Zelda] to the http://anidb.net/ch88463 [Princess Charlotte], who joined their cause just to buy enough time for the girls from http://anidb.net/ch92207 [Principal Team] to get in position and act. Major Ynqwie was supposed to use the key that would activate the mechanism which would make the ceiling collapse above the members of a royal family while they are in the Royal Cathedral. However, Princess stole the key from him and Zelda wounded her before she had a chance to run away. Before she could finish her off, Major stood in front of her and took a bullet, saving Princess from a certain death.

episode.title: Roaming Pigeons
Roaming Pigeons
case9 방황하는 비둘기들
Roaming Pigeons
episode.summary: The girls are sent to retrieve a certain prototype from the Kingdom. In the meantime, Dorothy must keep a close eye on a friend. Source: amazon

episode.title: Vice Voice
Vice Voice
case2 범죄의 목소리
Vice Voice
episode.summary: The connection between Ange and the princess comes to light, and the girls discover Beatrice`s extraordinary talents. Source: amazon

episode.title: Dancy Conspiracy
Dancy Conspiracy
case1 춤추는 음모
Dancy Conspiracy
episode.summary: Ange has just transferred into Queen`s Mayfaire Academy, and she`s on a mission to recruit the Princess. The only thing standing in her way is the Princess` agenda. Source: amazon

episode.title: Wired Liar
Wired Liar
case13 흥분한 거짓말쟁이
Wired Liar
episode.summary: In the world of spies, Ange works in the shadows but is suddenly moved when Eric makes a heartbreaking plea. Will Ange believe him? Source: amazon

episode.title: Ripper Dipper
Ripper Dipper
case20 살인마와 소매치기
Ripper Dipper
episode.summary: As Ange is painting, she is reminded of the first time she met the princess. With fiction and reality clashing, Ange questions herself. Source: amazon

episode.title: Loudly Laundry
Loudly Laundry
case16 시끌벅적 세탁소
Loudly Laundry
episode.summary: The girls have their next assignment, and they must infiltrate a laundry mill to find a deadly weapon. In the mill, they catch a glimpse of the workers` conditions. Source: amazon

episode.title: Rouge Morgue
Rouge Morgue
case18 붉은 시체안치소
Rouge Morgue
episode.summary: Dorothy must take a case that involves her father, to retrieve a something from a dead body at his morgue. Does this bring them back closer together? Source: amazon

episode.title: Bullet & Blade`s Ballad
Bullet & Blade`s Ballad
case7 총과 칼의 발라드
Bullet & Blade`s Ballad
episode.summary: The Princess must host Lord Horikawa during his time in the Kingdom of Albion. Only to be met with assassination attempts directed towards them both! Source: amazon

episode.title: Fall of the Wall
Fall of the Wall
case24 벽이 무너지다
Fall of the Wall
episode.summary: With time against her, Ange will stop at nothing until she has the princess next to her. Will she be too late to save her? Source: amazon

episode.title: Humble Double
Humble Double
case23 미천한, 미천한
Humble Double
episode.summary: Ange must now fulfill her newest orders: assassinate the princess. With outside forces starting to make their move, what will happen to the Princess and Ange? Source: amazon

episode.title: Comfort Comrade
Comfort Comrade
case22 위안을 주는 동료
Comfort Comrade
episode.summary: Control gives Ange and Dorothy a new assignment along with an old acquaintance. Unfortunately, old memories arise that can`t be swept away. Source: amazon

episode.title: Pell-mell Duel
Pell-mell Duel
case11 무모한 대결
Pell-mell Duel
episode.summary: Chise writes to her sister about her life in the Kingdom of Albion, and how she struggles to adapt to their customs but the girls try their best to make Chise feel at home. Source: amazon
